snippet: In search of a federal loan to build its cars at a plant in Delaware, Fisker is trying to re-establish its credibility as an independent automaker with cutting-edge technology.
abstract: Fisker Automotive is seeking to restore federal loans to build its hybrid electric cars at a plant in Delaware; company is attempting to re-establish credibility as an independent automaker with cutting-edge technology after setbacks that led the Energy Department to suspend loans to the company; Fisker has hired former Chrysler chief Tom LaSorda and has raised more than $1 billion in equity from private investors.
lead_paragraph: In search of a federal loan to build its cars at a plant in Delaware, Fisker is trying to re-establish its credibility as an independent automaker with cutting-edge technology.

headline.seo: Fisker Seeks Federal Loans to Build a Car in Delaware
headline.main: Seeking U.S. Loans for Plant, Fisker Scrambles to Restore Credibility
headline.print_headline: Seeking U.S. Loans for Plant, Fisker Scrambles to Restore Credibility
